definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

sentences.english: If escaping from death, need equestrian desert, in the future good stage a comeback.
sentences.chinese: 大難不死的話，就需要騎馬逃跑，日後好東山再起。

sentences.english: Those who have survived realize the meaning of life .
sentences.chinese: 那些劫後餘生大難不死的人，認識到了生命的意義。

sentences.english: a cat's ability to survive falls is based on fact.
sentences.chinese: 貓在跌落時能夠大難不死是有事實作依據的。

sentences.english: The boy, who was unscathed by his ordeal, left the mall with his father.
sentences.chinese: 這名大難不死的男孩兒隨後同他的爸爸離開了商場。

sentences.english: To realize the value of one second:Ask a person who has survived an accident.
sentences.chinese: 要想知道一秒鐘的價值，那就去問大難不死的人。

sentences.english: Two other workers attempted to kill themselves by jumping off buildings but survived.
sentences.chinese: 此外，還有兩名工人跳樓自殺，但大難不死。

sentences.english: You are lucky to be alive after the accident.
He always seems to land on his feet.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎總是能大難不死。

sentences.english: Sometimes there is survival of people in the crash.
sentences.chinese: 空難事件中有的人大難不死。

definition: to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
to fail to grasp the main points
to write off at one stroke
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
